title: 114_hr4302
content: The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating all functions of the Bank as outlined in the Act. Functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. The Secretary must report this determination to Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of functions transferred to them, handling outstanding obligations of the Federal Government from terminated programs, and taking necessary actions to dissolve any remaining affairs of the Bank. The Secretary can delegate functions to wind up transferred responsibilities. The Act does not authorize Bank positions or functions after 60 days of abolishment. Conforming amendments and repeals are also included. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act and handling outstanding obligations. The Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983, Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 1990, Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988, and certain sections of title 31, United States Code are amended or repealed. Additionally, positions at level iii and iv in the United States Code are also amended. Positions at level iv in the United States Code are amended by eliminating the First Vice President and Members of the Board of Directors of the Export-Import Bank of Washington. The Office of Inspector General for the Bank is also eliminated. The repeals and amendments made by this section will take effect on the abolishment date. Additionally, a report to Congress on other necessary amendments to Federal statutes will be submitted by the Secretary. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal law, executive order, rule, regulation, or delegation of authority to a department or office is deemed to refer to the department or office to which the function is transferred. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. "Function" includes duty, power, or program. "Office" includes any administrative entity.
